titles.title: Congressional Award Program Reauthorization Act of 2013
Congressional Award Program Reauthorization Act of 2013
Congressional Award Program Reauthorization Act of 2013
Congressional Award Program Reauthorization Act of 2013
A bill to reauthorize the Congressional Award Act.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

action.text: Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. Reported by Senator Carper without amendment. With written report No. 113-109.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 196.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Ms. Foxx moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1348.

At the conclusion of debate, the chair put the question on the motion to suspend the rules. Ms. Foxx objected to the vote on the grounds that a quorum was not present. Further proceedings on the motion were postponed. The point of no quorum was considered as withdrawn.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 387 - 35 (Roll no. 503).

committee.name: Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

term.name: Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary: 10/4/2013--Public Law. Congressional Award Program Reauthorization Act of 2013 - Amends the Congressional Award Act to extend the date for termination of the Congressional Award Board from October 1, 2013, to October 1, 2018.
